alert.note: Alert for Concordia (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 10:21AM CDT until April 30 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi...Louisiana... Mississippi River At Natchez affecting Wilkinson, Concordia and Adams Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON TO SATURDAY, APRIL 30... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River At Natchez. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon to Saturday, April 30. * IMPACTS...At 48.0 feet, Carthage Point Road becomes impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 45.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage early Saturday afternoon to a crest of 49.0 feet on Monday evening. - Flood stage is 48.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Mississippi River Natchez 48.0 45.5 Tue 9 pm CDT 46.6 47.4 47.9 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Forecast includes rainfall on the ground and 48 hours of additional rainfall. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN The next statement will be issued this evening at 9 PM CDT.
